reflection.win_details: 4 exceptional training sessions with PRs, diet on point until end of week
reflection.main_barrier: Food cravings and meal boredom - not planning appropriately

macrofactor.note: Dec 15 was a higher calorie day (5239 cal)

wellbeing.injuries: Ongoing - managing around hamstring and chest
wellbeing.injury_detail: Keeping bench and deadlifts lighter as precaution, not limiting training

training.notes: PRs hit, exceptional session quality despite moderate recovery metrics

coach_summary.executive_summary: Outstanding training week with 4 exceptional sessions and PRs despite moderate recovery (59% avg). Higher strain week (13.4 avg) with two big training days (Dec 15 & 21 both 16+ strain). Training quality outperformed WHOOP recovery predictions. Food boredom is the main barrier to address post-holidays.

outlook_analysis.interpretation: High outlook (8-10) matches exceptional training quality. Good self-awareness - you know you're in a strong phase.

pattern_analysis.key_correlation: Higher strain week (13.4) with 2 green recovery days shows good adaptation capacity

forward_action_validation.suggestion: Consider adding 2-3 new meal options to combat food boredom post-holidays

recommendations: Continue current training approach - PRs indicate productive phase
Sleep performance (74%) is the weak link - aim for 7.5h+ consistently
Post-Christmas: spend 30min planning 3 new meal options for variety
The Dec 17 short sleep (4h41m) hurt - avoid back-to-back short nights
Hamstring/chest management is smart - continue lighter loads until confidence returns
questions_for_coach: Higher strain week (13.4) sustainable given recovery pattern?
Food boredom strategy - any meal prep suggestions for variety?
coach_summary.accountability_reminder: Next check-in: Monday Dec 29 or early Jan
